attributes.action: Adjust teachers pay so it reflects the rises in inflation since 2007.
attributes.additional_details:
Data is easily found by checking pay scales online and using inflation calculation tools. 
Percentage changes for different points on the scale may vary, but I suspect it wont be by much. 
I am not asking for backdated pay so teachers receive what they should have done in back pay,  just for the pay to be back on par with 2007 levels.
attributes.background: In 2007 the highest basic wage a teacher could earn was £34281 (based on UPR 3 outside London). Since then inflation has risen by 38%, but due to long term pay freezes the teachers pay has only risen by 18.1%, meaning the standard of living of hardworking teachers has fallen dramatically.
